cluster_classes.class_description: Deprecated high-level aggregate for flowering plant reproduction. This class was previously used to bundle organisms (flowering plants), reproductive processes (pollination), and structures, but has been superseded by more specific classes: Plant Reproductive Structures, Pollination (Flowering Plant Process), and Flowering Plants (Organisms). It is retained only for backward compatibility and should not receive new members.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Pollination transfers pollen between flowers, enabling plant reproduction; plants are the organisms whose reproduction is assisted.
remarks: This class has been structurally split into separate process (pollination) and organism (flowering plants) classes and may now have no direct members; consider deprecating or repurposing in a later cleanup pass.

This class has no members and its original scope is now cleanly covered by ClsC_fb0a1cd7 (Plant Reproductive Structures), ClsR_9ddc1c4b (Pollination (Flowering Plant Process)), and ClsR_2f847eb5 (Flowering Plants (Organisms)). Treat this as a deprecated aggregate container; avoid assigning new entities here and migrate any legacy members into the more specific classes.

This class is an empty, deprecated aggregate whose semantic scope is fully covered by more specific classes; moving it into a dedicated 'Deprecated & Legacy Container Classes' group prevents it from being treated as an active semantic node in the flowering plant/pollination domain.

cluster_classes.class_label: DEPRECATED â€“ Caterpillar Growth and Molting (legacy container)
cluster_classes.class_description: Deprecated umbrella class that formerly grouped caterpillar growth and molting processes. All known entities have been moved into more specific subclasses (e.g., Caterpillar Rapid Growth, Caterpillar Molting Process). This class is retained only for backward compatibility and should not be used for new annotations.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Caterpillars grow rapidly and shed their skin several times as they grow.
remarks: This class is now effectively empty after splitting; consider deprecating or hiding it from primary use.
This class is now empty after its contents were split into more specific process classes. Marked as deprecated to prevent future use while preserving backward compatibility.

This class is a fully empty, deprecated container used only for backward compatibility; aligning it with the global 'Deprecated & Legacy Container Classes' group keeps it out of active Caterpillar biology semantics while preserving legacy mappings.

cluster_classes.class_label: Deprecated: Urban Legend Elements (superseded by split classes)
cluster_classes.class_description: Legacy container class that previously mixed bait objects and audience roles for cautionary urban legends; its members have been moved into more specific split classes.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Stories of strangers luring children with candy ... warn listeners about the dangers
remarks: This class is now empty after splitting its members into more specific classes and can be treated as deprecated or removed in a future cleanup step.
This class is fully empty after prior splits and should be treated as deprecated; avoid assigning new entities and consider archiving or deleting it in a dedicated cleanup step.

This class is an empty legacy container that has been fully superseded by split classes; moving it into a dedicated 'Deprecated & Legacy Container Classes' group avoids falsely connecting it to active urban-legend schema while keeping it available for legacy compatibility.

cluster_classes.class_description: DEPRECATED legacy aggregate class that previously bundled general adult butterflies and female butterflies. All former members have been moved into more precise classes (e.g., 'Adult butterflies' and 'Female butterflies'). This class is retained only for backward compatibility and must not receive new members.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: adult butterflies, including female butterflies that lay eggs on host plants
remarks: This class is now empty after splitting its members into more precise classes. Prefer using 'Adult butterflies (all sexes)' or 'Female butterflies' going forward.

This class is an empty legacy aggregate for adult butterflies and should be treated as deprecated; avoid adding new members and prefer the dedicated 'Adult butterflies' and 'Female butterflies' classes.
This class is intentionally kept empty as a deprecated legacy aggregate; schema consumers should migrate to 'Adult butterflies' and 'Female butterflies' and avoid using this class going forward.

This is an intentionally empty legacy aggregate for adult butterflies; placing it in the shared deprecated-container group avoids treating it as an active butterfly-biology node while maintaining backward compatibility for legacy annotations.

args.remark: This class is a fully empty, deprecated container used only for backward compatibility; aligning it with the global 'Deprecated & Legacy Container Classes' group keeps it out of active Caterpillar biology semantics while preserving legacy mappings.
args.justification: ClsC_b049d5f9 is explicitly described as an empty, deprecated umbrella/legacy container whose content was split into more specific process classes, so it should be grouped with other deprecated legacy containers rather than the active 'Caterpillar Anatomy and Physiology' domain.

args.remark: This is an intentionally empty legacy aggregate for adult butterflies; placing it in the shared deprecated-container group avoids treating it as an active butterfly-biology node while maintaining backward compatibility for legacy annotations.
args.justification: ClsC_2d1cc363 is marked as a deprecated legacy aggregate with all members moved into more precise butterfly classes, so it should be aligned with other deprecated & legacy container classes instead of remaining in the active 'Butterfly Biology' group.
